[1]:

import numpy as np
from matplotlib import pyplot as plt
from default_parameters import *
from osc_prob import *

[2]:

from matplotlib import rc

rc("figure", figsize=(10, 6))
rc("font", **{"family": "sans-serif", "sans-serif": ["Helvetica"]})
rc("lines", linewidth=2)
rc("axes", labelsize=17, linewidth=1, grid=True, labelpad=-1)
rc("axes.spines", right=True)
rc("xtick", direction="in", labelsize=17, top=True)
rc("xtick.major", width=0.8, size=10)
rc("ytick", direction="in", labelsize=17, right=True)
rc("ytick.major", width=0.8, size=10)
rc("legend", fancybox=False, fontsize=17, shadow=False)
rc("grid", linewidth=1.0, ls="dotted")
from IPython.display import set_matplotlib_formats

set_matplotlib_formats("retina")

/tmp/ipykernel_22377/1198381260.py:14: DeprecationWarning: `set_matplotlib_formats` is deprecated since IPython 7.23, directly use `matplotlib_inline.backend_inline.set_matplotlib_formats()`
  set_matplotlib_formats('retina')

The function probability_general is the most general formula. It returns probability of muon oscillations with/without matter effects, for NO/IO#

$ \textbf{Example #1: Comparison of exact probility in matter, in vacuum and leading approximation}$

[3]:

energy = np.linspace(0.2, 2, 1000)
U = PMNS()

prob_mue_NO = probability_vacuum(U=U, E=energy, beta=0)
prob_mue_NO_matter = probability_general(E=energy, beta=0)
prob_mue_approx = probability_vacuum_approx(beta=0, E=energy)

[4]:

plt.plot(energy, prob_mue_NO_matter, label="Exact formula in matter")
plt.plot(energy, prob_mue_NO, label="Exact formula in vacuum")
plt.plot(energy, prob_mue_approx, label="Leading approximation")

plt.ylabel(r"$P (\nu_\mu \rightarrow \nu_e)$")


plt.legend()

$ \textbf{Example #3}:$ Comparison of NO and IO in vacuum and in matter

[5]:

U = PMNS(delta_cp=-90)
energy = np.linspace(0.25, 2, 1000)

prob_mue_NO = probability_vacuum(U, beta=0, E=energy)
prob_mue_IO = probability_vacuum(U, beta=0, E=energy, dm2_32=-dm2_32_BF)
plt.plot(energy, prob_mue_NO, label="NO, vacuum")
plt.plot(energy, prob_mue_IO, label="IO, vacuum")

plt.ylabel(r"$P (\nu_\mu \rightarrow \nu_e)$")
plt.xlabel("energy, GeV")
plt.legend()
plt.savefig("Vacuum")

[6]:

prob_mue_matter_NO = probability_general(E=energy, beta=0, delta_cp=radians(90))
prob_mue_matter_NO2 = probability_general(E=energy, beta=0, delta_cp=radians(-90))
prob_mue_matter_IO = probability_general(
    E=energy, beta=0, delta_cp=radians(90), MO="IO"
)
prob_mue_matter_IO2 = probability_general(
    E=energy, beta=0, delta_cp=radians(-90), MO="IO"
)

prob_mue_matter_anti_NO = probability_general_anti(
    E=energy, beta=0, delta_cp=radians(90)
)
prob_mue_matter_anti_NO2 = probability_general_anti(
    E=energy, beta=0, delta_cp=radians(-90)
)
prob_mue_matter_anti_IO = probability_general_anti(
    E=energy, beta=0, delta_cp=radians(90), MO="IO"
)
prob_mue_matter_anti_IO2 = probability_general_anti(
    E=energy, beta=0, delta_cp=radians(-90), MO="IO"
)

[7]:

plt.plot(energy, prob_mue_matter_NO, label="NO, matter")
plt.plot(energy, prob_mue_matter_IO, label="IO, matter")

plt.legend()

$ \textbf{Example #3}:$ General plot for different MO and \(\delta_{CP}\)

[8]:

rc("figure", figsize=(20, 9))
fig, [ax, ax2] = plt.subplots(1, 2)
plt.axes(ax)
ax.fill_between(
    energy,
    prob_mue_matter_NO,
    prob_mue_matter_NO2,
    label=r"Normal ordering $\nu_\mu \rightarrow \nu_e$",
)
plt.plot(
    energy, prob_mue_matter_NO, label=r"NO, $\delta_{CP}=90$", color="blue", ls="--"
)
plt.plot(energy, prob_mue_matter_NO2, label=r"NO, $\delta_{CP}=-90$", color="blue")

ax.fill_between(
    energy,
    prob_mue_matter_IO,
    prob_mue_matter_IO2,
    label=r"Inverse ordering $\nu_\mu \rightarrow \nu_e$",
)
ax.fill_between(
    energy,
    prob_mue_matter_IO2,
    prob_mue_matter_NO,
    label="Degeneracy region",
    color="saddlebrown",
)
plt.plot(
    energy, prob_mue_matter_IO, label=r"IO, $\delta_{CP}=90$", color="red", ls="--"
)
plt.plot(energy, prob_mue_matter_IO2, label=r"IO, $\delta_{CP}=-90$", color="red")
plt.xlabel("energy. GeV")
plt.ylabel(r"P($\nu_\mu \rightarrow \nu_e$)")
plt.legend()

plt.axes(ax2)

ax2.fill_between(
    energy,
    prob_mue_matter_anti_NO,
    prob_mue_matter_anti_NO2,
    label=r"Normal ordering $\bar{\nu}_\mu \rightarrow \bar{\nu}_e$",
)
plt.plot(
    energy,
    prob_mue_matter_anti_NO,
    label=r"NO, $\delta_{CP}=90$",
    color="blue",
    ls="--",
)
plt.plot(energy, prob_mue_matter_anti_NO2, label=r"NO, $\delta_{CP}=-90$", color="blue")

ax2.fill_between(
    energy,
    prob_mue_matter_anti_IO,
    prob_mue_matter_anti_IO2,
    label=r"Inverse ordering $\bar{\nu}_\mu \rightarrow \bar{\nu}_e$",
)
plt.plot(
    energy, prob_mue_matter_anti_IO, label=r"IO, $\delta_{CP}=90$", color="red", ls="--"
)
plt.plot(energy, prob_mue_matter_anti_IO2, label=r"IO, $\delta_{CP}=-90$", color="red")

ax2.fill_between(
    energy,
    prob_mue_matter_anti_NO,
    prob_mue_matter_anti_IO2,
    label="Degeneracy region",
    color="saddlebrown",
)

plt.xlabel("energy, GeV")
plt.ylabel(r"P($\bar{\nu}_\mu \rightarrow \bar{\nu}_e$)")
plt.legend()
plt.savefig("ME")
